results.title: Hi 5 snow party
results.creator_credit: Helena Harris, Posie Graeme-Evans, Ian Munro, Kids Like Us, Nine Films and Television and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: The Hi5 gang - Tim Harding, Nathan Foley, Kathleen De Leon, Kellie Hoggart and Charli Robinson have lots of fun together, singing, dancing, telling stories and discovering how and why things happen. Suitable for lower primary school children.

results.title: Le Capitan
results.creator_credit: Andre Hunebelle, Paul Cadeac, Pierre Caband and Rene Bezard
results.brief_description:
In 1616 King Louis XIII is only 15 and his kingdom is administered by Regent Marie de Medicis and her favourite, Concini. Concini hopes to use power and influence to overthrow the young king but his plan is violently opposed by the peers of the Kingdom who have their own candidate to the succession, Charles d’Angouleme. As Concini terrorises his opponents, the kingdom is on the verge of a civil war. In order to save his life and his throne, the young king enlists the help of Francois, also known as Le Capitan, the best swashbuckler of the kingdom, and his sidekick, Cogolin.

Credits: Producers, Paul Cadeac, Pierre Caband, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Pierre Foucaud, Andre Hunebelle ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Pierrette Bruno, Lise Delamare, Annie Anderson, Guy Delorme, Jean Marais.

results.title: L'ecume des Jours = the Froth of Time
results.creator_credit: Charles Belmont, Andre Michelin and Philippe Senne
results.brief_description:
Colin, a rich and sentimental young man loves Chloe. His friend Chick shares his passion for literature and neglects his girlfriend Alise. Nicolas, driver and cook, is watching over this peaceful ‘world’. Colin’s life would be perfect, if only Chloe was not suffering from a mysterious disease.

Credits: Producers, Andre Michelin, Philippe Senne ; director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles belmont, Philippe Dumarcay, Pierre Pelegri ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Andre Hodeir.
Cast: Jacques Perrin, Marie-France Pisier, Sami Frey, Alexandra Stewart, Annie Buron, Delphine Seyrig.

results.title: Wild in the country
results.creator_credit: Philip Dunne, Jerry Wald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays troubled and angry local boy Glenn Talbot in this 1960’s adaptation of J.R. Salamanca’s novel “Wild in the Country”. The movie opens with Glenn and his brother brawling and the fight lands Glenn in front of the probation board yet again. The board gives him a second chance on the condition he is given into the custody of his Uncle and attends sessions with local psychologist Irene Spencer (Hope Lange). Glenn battles against his temper and old wild ways with the help of Irene who encourages him to pursue his writing and helps him get into college. The pair, high on Glenn’s success and sheltering from a storm in a motel, declare their love, but contain their desire for one another. Fearful of her feelings towards Glenn, Irene spurns his love by agreeing to marry another; Glenn, enraged by the news goes on a drunken spree and looks to be reverting back to his wicked ways. Cast also includes Tuesday Weld, Millie Perkins, John Ireland and Rafer Johnson.

results.title: It's a mad mad mad mad world
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A mammoth cast includes Spencer Tracy, Milton Berle, Sid Caeser, Buddy Hackett, Ethel Merman, Mickey Rooney, Dick Shawn, Phil Silvers, Terry Thomas, Jonathan Winters, Edie Adams, Dorothy Provine, Peter Falk and Jimmy Durante. Kramer’s film recalls the zany slapstick era of silent films. Durante is a dying millionaire who gives a secret clue to the location of his buried fortune. Everyone is out to beat everyone else to the loot and nothing is done in moderation. Every obstacle is put in the path of the treasure-seekers and dealt with in unexpected or illogical ways. With this bevy of comic actors, no single performance shines and the laughs abound.

results.title: Funny bones
results.creator_credit: Peter Chelsom, Simon Fields and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Tommy Fawkes (Oliver Platt), is a struggling stand-up comedian trying to live up to the legacy that his famous father George Fawkes (Jerry Lewis) has created. George is now retired, and Tommy is struggling to get his career started. After yet another painful failure onstage, Tommy decides to travel back to Blackpool, England, where his family’s history and comedy originated and during his stay, Tommy discovers some not so funny secrets about his family and his past. During this time he develops a peculiar friendship with the mysterious Jack Parker (Lee Evans), the seemingly dim, comedian-savant. This film, a “black slapstick comedy” goes beyond any genre, utilizing brilliant psychological and physical performances right down to the eyebrow raising cameo from Oliver Reed. Written by Peter Chelsom and Peter Flannery.

results.title: Islands in the stream
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Max Palewsky, Peter Bart and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: Abridged version of Hemingway’s novel. An artist living alone on his island retreat is visited by his sons. Over the summer, he discovers their mutual need and respect. (This section, however, is not representative of the theme of the novel as a whole). Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hamlet (Zeffirelli)
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Dyson Lovell, Nelson Films and World Icon
results.brief_description: On a windswept battlement looming over a stormy sea, in a stone castle guarding a northern kingdom, a man stands alone, haunted by the mysteries of fate, love, violence, tenderness, revenge. Searching for the truth behind an evil deed which left his father dead and his mother sitting on a royal throne beside the murderer. Tortured by his inability to take action. Searching for his very soul. Hamlet, Prince of Denmark. This lavish production directed by Franco Zeffirelli has assembled a cast to infuse the Shakespearian classic with a new light. Starring Mel Gibson as Hamlet opposite Glenn Close in the role of Gertrude and a supporting cast that includes, Alan Bates, Paul Scofield, Ian Holm and Helena Bonham-Carter as Ophelia.

results.title: Now voyager
results.creator_credit: Irving Rapper, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Bette Davis delivered a superlative performance as a neurotic spinster fighting to free herself from the shackles of a tyrannical mother. Pushed into a nervous breakdown, the dowdy Davis is cured by a psychiatrist (Claude Rains) and emerges as a poised and beautiful woman - only to be trapped in a doomed romance with a married man. Also stars Paul Henreid. Based on the novel by Olive Higgins Pronty.

results.title: Unfolding Florence: the many lives of Florence Broadhurst
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Nicholas Beauman, Charles Hannah, Sue Clothier, Becker Entertainment, Film Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, SBS Independent and Katherine Thomson
results.brief_description: Almost everyone thinks they know who I was and, of course, everyone thinks they know who killed me. A celebration of the life of flamboyant Australian design pioneer Florence Broadhurst, this highly original documentary explores the many lives of one larger-than-life woman. Acclaimed director Gillian Armstrong “unfolds” Broadhurst’s story from her birth, in 1899, into a farming family in outback Australia, to 1920s Shanghai, where she ran her own performing arts academy, to the fashion scene of 1930s London, and to her painting tours of northern and central Australia in the early 1950s. In her last incarnation, as a designer and manufacturer of wallpapers, Broadhurst produced high-quality, handcrafted wallpapers in luxurious, oversized patterns with vivid combinations of colours, inspired by an eclectic range of sources. More than 100 years after her birth, her work has been rediscovered by the world’s leading fashion, interior and homeware designers and her prints are in huge demand internationally. Broadhurst was brutally murdered on 15 October 1977 at her Paddington premises; and the killer has never been identified. Broadhurst was renowned for her flamboyant clothes, antique jewellery and coiffed, hennaed hair. “Unfolding Florence” explores her life in a vibrant and unconventional style, with more than a touch of humour and irreverence; a fitting approach to this unusual woman’s story. Cast includes Judi Farr (as Florence) and Felicity Price (as the young Florence).
